title: 24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters
synopsis: The rise, fall and rebirth of the art of movie posters.

title: 24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters
synopsis: The rise, fall and rebirth of the art of movie posters.

title: B.B. King: The Life of Riley
synopsis: Narrated by Morgan Freeman, this documentary features interviews with Bono, Eric Clapton, Dr. John and Bruce Willis, as well as over 20 other heavyweight contributors, including appearances by Keith Richards, Mick Jagger and Barack Obama. Filmed on location all over America, as well as the United Kingdom, B.B. King: The Life of Riley brings to life the heat - and gin-soaked plantations - where it all began. With full access to the B.B. King Museum’s archives in Mississippi, the documentary includes many unseen interviews from people who grew up with the young Riley B. King. Prejudice and segregation has stained the lives of countless black persons and B.B. ‘Riley’ King made sure that, through his music, he never allowed it to mar his spirit. This is the essence of the story that makes an astoundingly beautiful, informative and visually captivating film.

title: Buried
synopsis:
Ryan Reynolds is buried alive and running out of air. 

WHY WE PICKED IT: This claustrophobic thriller contains the entirety of its action within the coffin, cleverly escalating the tension to gut-wrenching effect.

title: Capote
synopsis:
The story-behind-the-story of writing ‘In Cold Blood.’ 

WHY WE PICKED IT: Philip Seymour Hoffman’s transformative performance is a riveting, poignant portrayal of an oft-mythologized American icon.

title: Lost in Paris
synopsis:
A sweetly comic, whimsical romp through the City of Light. 

WHY WE PICKED IT: This stylish screwball comedy from husband and wife filmmakers Abel and Gordon features Emmanuelle Riva’s final, fantastic performance.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
synopsis: The story of two couples - confirmed bachelor Benedick and caustic Beatrice, and young Claudio and innocent Hero. Playful bickering defines one couple, whereas romance and betrayal describe the other. The all-star cast includes Denzel Washington, Kate Beckinsale, Keanu Reeves, and Emma Thompson. Directed by Kenneth Branagh and nominated for the Palme d'Or at the 1993 Cannes Film Festival.
